article_title: Missing sisters found safe, returned to their home in West Dallas
article_text:
Update at 5:20 p.m.: The two sisters have been found and returned home safely.

Police are seeking the public’s help in finding two sisters who have been missing since Saturday morning.

Jasmine Clayton, 14, and Alana Harris, 8, were last seen leaving their West Dallas home in the 3900 block of Bickers Street, walking toward Westmoreland Road. Both were carrying backpacks.

Jasmine is described as 5-foot-5 and about 100 pounds with black hair and brown eyes. Alana is 4 feet tall and 70 pounds with black hair and brown eyes. Their clothing description is unknown.

Anyone with information is asked to call Dallas police at 911 or 214-671-4268.

Alana is 4 feet tall and 70 pounds with black hair and brown eyes.
Police are seeking the public’s help in finding two sisters who have been missing since Saturday morning.
Update at 5:20 p.m.: The two sisters have been found and returned home safely.
